name: Dosa
history: Dosa is a traditional South Indian dish, particularly from Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, and Kerala. It's known for its thin, crispy texture and is commonly made from a fermented rice and lentil batter.
description: Dosa is a thin, crispy pancake or crepe, originating from South India, made from a fermented batter of rice and black lentils. It's a staple dish in Indian cuisine, often served with chutney and sambar.

equipment.name: blender or grinder
equipment.description: Used for grinding the rice and lentils into a fine batter.

equipment.name: non-stick skillet or traditional iron tawa
ladle
equipment.description: Used for pouring and spreading the batter.

equipment.name: spatula
equipment.description: Used for flipping and removing the dosa.

instructions.title: Soak and Grind
instructions.description: Soak the rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds in water for 6-8 hours. Drain and grind them to a fine batter, adding water as required.

instructions.title: Ferment the Batter
instructions.description: Transfer the batter to a large bowl. Add salt and allow it to ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or until it doubles in size.

instructions.title: Prepare Dosa
instructions.description: Heat a non-stick skillet or tawa. Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it in a circular motion to make a thin crepe. Drizzle a little oil around the edges and cook until the dosa turns golden brown.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the dosa hot with chutney and sambar.

tips: Ensure the skillet or tawa is moderately hot; a sprinkle of water should sizzle right away.
Fermentation time may vary based on the climate; warmer climates ferment batter faster.
variations: Masala Dosa: Fill with a potato mixture.
Rava Dosa: Made with semolina and rice flour, without fermentation.

storage.shelfLife: The batter can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container and refrigerate.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat dosas on a skillet until crisp.
presentationTips: Serve with a variety of chutneys and sambar for an authentic experience.
